Items.Title: Resolution condemning the fatal shootings of Renée Nicole Good and Alex Jeffrey Pretti by federal immigration authorities
Items.AgendaNote: Adopted by the Committee on Immigration
Items.MinutesNote:
Pursuant to Rule 8.60 of the Council, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) called for a voice vote.  Hearing those in favor, the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu) declared the Resolution to be adopted.



The following 8 Council Members formally noted their intent to vote negative on this item: 



Council Members Ariola, Gennaro, Mealy, Morano, Paladino, Vernikov, Wong, and the Minority Leader (Council Member Carr).


Adopted by the Council by voice-vote.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Resolution be Approved, by Council approved by voice vote.
Items.MatterName: Condemning the fatal shootings of Renée Nicole Good and Alex Jeffrey Pretti by federal immigration authorities.

INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Pursuant to Section 33-a of the New York City Charter, the New York City Council may vote on the following items no earlier than 30 days from the date of this notice. The New York City Council reserves the right to vote without the notice required pursuant to Section 33-a on any proposed local laws that do not relate to the public safety operations of the New York City Police Department, the Fire Department or the Department of Correction.

Items.MinutesNote: The Majority Leader (Council Member Abreu) presiding as the Acting President Pro Tempore.

The presence of a quorum was announced by the Majority Leader and Acting President Pro Tempore (Council Member Abreu).

There is one vacant seat on the Council pending the swearing-in of the certified winner of a Special Election to be held on April 28, 2026 in the 3rd Council District (Manhattan).

There were 49 Council Members marked present for this Stated Meeting.

At this point the Speaker (Council Member Menin) made the following announcements:
